name: Watermelon Patch Game
description:
The children's game in which players capture watermelons with a pole.

Watermelon Patch reinforced derogatory stereotypes with images of blacks stealing and eating melons.

Comes with two wooden fishing poles and many watermelon game pieces.

name: Jeopardy! Junior Edition
description:
FROM THE BOX:
Based on the hit tv game show.

The fast-action quiz game developed just for kids! Featuring over 2000 fun and challenging questions.

Jeopardy!'s trademark is that answers must be asked in the form of a question.

name: Napoleonic Scenarios
description:
Scenarios for Napoleonic Miniatures gaming with any rules systems (strategic, grand tactical, or tactical) and any size miniatures.

Each scenario features:
A description of the campaign leading up to the battle
Complete order of battle
A historical description of the battle itself
Complete GM notes that provide helpful hints on running the battle, not matter the rules system used
Both historical and balanced victory conditions
A full color map of the battlefield with initial dispositions of units at the start of the battle

The book also contains numerous photographs of the battles being played

name: Tricolor: Rules for Grand Tactical Level Miniature Wargames in 15mm
description: Introductory level set of rules designed with 15mm miniatures representing troops of the various armies of the Napoleonic Wars c. 1800-1815

name: Fire and Discipline: 1:10 Scale Rules 1740-1850
description:
Miniature rules designed to simulate tactical warfare during the period 1740 - 1850. While the rules can be used for European battles, the focus is on non-European conflicts such as those which occurred in India and the America

SCALES:
One casting equals ten men but up to 13 men in some organizations
One turn equals two minutes
One inch equals ten yards with 15mm and 20mm+ castings.
One centimeter equals 5 yards with 15mm castings and 20mm+ castings.
A stand represents an infantry company, firing platoon; a cavalry troop or gun section.

name: Playable Napoleonic Wargames
description:
Rulebook for miniature wargaming in the Napoleonic period from about 1792 up to 1815. The particular focus is on simulating the conflict of British and French armies in Spain and Portugal between 1807 and 1814.

The book comes with a complete set of wargame rules and campaign rules, including various options and a large campaign map.

name: Tattletales
description:
FROM THE ARTICLE:

Based on the Goodson-Todman TV Game, Tattletales...see on Prime time Daytime T.V. and at night once a week. To play, partners must match answers to given questions. Matching of points wins the game and the dubious honor of ending a great "Tattletale".

Contains: Scoreboard, Play Money, Question Booklet, Covers, Pads, Woden Makers, Couple Tokens, and Stands, Instructions.

(NOTE: Though no home game of Tattletales was ever released to the public, Hasbro promoted a home game version in a 1978 catalog sent to its dealers. However, The company reconsidered it when the show got cancelled around the same year.)

name: The Chromatical Gambler
description: A game intended to teach music score reading skills and music scales. In a game similar to Parcheesi/Ludo, three pawns have to move around a board comprised of chromatical scales, only using the notes belonging to one specific musical key.

name: Witch Hunt: Ravenwicke
description:
From website:

Witch Hunt is a Tabletop card game for 1-8 players.

As a witch hunter, you make your way through the village of Ravenwicke discovering items, artifacts, and assistance in the most unexpected places. However, time is short. As ingredients are added to her cauldron, the witch gains power and tightens her grip on the village. Once all five of the ingredients have been added to the cauldron, the witch wins the game! So, it is of the utmost urgency that you find her before the last ingredient is added to her brew. Oh, and did we mention that one of you is actually the witch?

Set in the backdrop of the small village of Ravenwicke, Witch Hunt is a closed-deck (72+ cards) card game that features 3 modes of play. The Angry Mob mode for 3-8 players, a Player versus Player mode, and HERO mode for only the bravest of souls.

NOTE:

The First Edition Deck is delivered in a sealed 3.5"x5" Telescoping Box and is our core deck of 72+ cards for playing Witch Hunt. The box also contains 8 oversized character cards, 2 six-sided dice, and 100 resource tokens.

The Family Edition brings a new dimension to hunting witches. In addition to all the benefits of the Witch Hunt First Edition Deck, the Family Edition comes with a beautiful 18"x18" Village Game Board, delivered in a sealed 10"x10" Game Box. The Family Edition also includes all of the core cards, 8 oversized character cards, 2 six-sided dice, and 100 resource tokens

The Kickstarter Special Edition Bundle includes: The Pirate Expansion, The Witch Coven Expansion, 5 Special Edition Cards.

name: Pizza Express
description:
The town's pizza bakers are well known for their delicious pizzas. To make sure they are freshly prepared, each pizza baker has installed a pizza oven in his delivery van. The customer receives the freshest pizza, baked hot and crispy right outside his front door.

The players are all pizza bakers with their own pizza oven express vans. The game board is a town "map" with roads, signal lights, barriers, one-way streets, supermarkets and six pizza customers.

Todays pizza customer is decided by throwing the die. A cute littel wodden house is placed on the location to identify where to deliver the pizza.
All the bakers then set off in their vans to deliver the pizza to the hungry customer. If you are the first to arrive at the customer's house, you will recieve moey for your pizza before a new customer shows up. To win the game you must be the fastes pizza baker three times.

It is a turn based game where you have two options each turn after having trown the dice: Drive in the direction of the pizza customer, or play a card.

The cards give the following possible actions: 
- Switch trafic light from red to green or green to red.
- Open or close a barrier.
- Blocking a street in both directions
- Turning a steet into a one-way street.
- Move your opponent's van by the number thrown - usually in reverse.
- Request all players to visit a supermarket to stock up supplies before continuing to the customer.
- Cancel pizza order and throw the dice to decide who is the new pizza customer.

The number of cards are limited for each delivery round (3-5 depending of number of players), and not restocked untill a pizza is delivered.

A fast game about delicious pizzas and fast pizza bakers!

All parts made of wood.

name: Trendy Apples to Apples Snack Pack
description:
A pop-culture focused miniature edition of Apples to Apples. Playable as a standalone game or combined with the original.

Players select the card from their hand that they think is best described by the adjective card played by the judge. If the judge picks their card, they win that round.

name: Pip•Pip
description:
Pip•Pip is a strategic board game of conversion and compromise. It is inspired in equal parts by Sudoku and Triple Triad.

There are two players, both with a handful of six-sided dice.

On each player's turn, he rolls a die and place it on a space within a 4×4 grid.

When players place a die in a space horizontally or vertically adjacent to an opponent’s die, they check the numbers on the two dice that are facing each other. If the number on the current player's die is greater, the opponent’s die is converted to the current player's color.

Players continue placing dice and converting die colors until all the spaces in the 4×4 area are filled. Once this occurs, the game is over and the players tally their scores.

The game usually comes down to the wire, with the winner achieving victory by the skin of his teeth.

name: Silly Situations
description:
You've found yourself in a bit of a pickle! Can you make the most of a silly situation with a bunch of random objects? Pick up, trade, and collect object cards to create a wild and wacky story. Use all the object cards in your hand to win!

On your turn you can draw a card, pass, trade cards or tell a story with a set of three Object cards. The first player to get rid of all your cards wins.

name: Campaign Book #7: The War of Independence in the North
description: Presents information on the organization of the respective armies during the war, the Orders of Battle for several actions as well as some information on flags and standards of the period

name: A Wargamer's Guide to The First Crusade 1097-1099AD
description:
A booklet on campaigns and battles of the medieval period, from the 5th to 15th centuries, intended to give an up to date historical account of the events and provide a beginner's guide to wargaming those events

Includes:

    Concise, footnoted, historical narrative of the campaign, including sections on personalities, troops, armaments and strategic movements.
    Accounts the battles of Dorylaeum, Antioch, and Ascalon, fully describing from contemporary and archaeological sources.
    Chapters on wargaming the campaign and the three battles using available commercial board games and miniature rules, including appropriate army lists.
    Simple painting guide


Softback; 55 pages.

name: Chevy Chase
description:
The Deer Stalking Game.

The board shows a deer park divided into two Chases by a high wall which has gaps through it. If a huntsman moves on to the same straight line as the stag (providing there is no obstruction of wall or rock in between) the stag is counted as dead and is removed from the board. There are five stags to bag and the winner is the huntsman who bags the largest number of stags.

The huntsmen throw the dice in turn and move along the brown dots according to the number cast. They can only move from dot to dot along the straight lines. They cannot turn corners and they must move the exact number or not at all. If a huntsman moves on to the same straight line as the stag (providing there is no obstruction of a wall or rock in between) the stag is counted as dead and becomes their trophy.

The part of the stag is played by the two huntsmen in turn as follows: a huntsman moves his own piece first then if he wishes he can move the stag either one or two dots in a straight line.

name: Auf den Spuren seltener Tiere
description:
In this roll-and-move game the 2-4 players are wildlife photographers, traveling around the globe to the wildlife reserves for photo shoots of endangered animals. The rarer the animal the more points the photo is worth in the end. The player with the most points wins.

The game theme is based on a popular German animal documentary TV series of the 1960s and early 1970s.

name: Going to the Fire
description: Typical spin and move board game. Object of the game is to reach the fire and return to the starting point.

name: Bimbes
description:
Objective: Be the first arriving at Berlin having successfully collected 8 million Euro (illegal money) for the upcoming elections 2002 in Germany 
 - acting/moving by turns -
'dark-black' satirical approach describing a world of corruption, bribery... using offshore accounts in bordering countries financing upcoming elections.

Roll & move, draw cards...  making up decisions to collect and stash money, make promises and betray others...

Game reflects the political scandal about the German former chancellor Kohl.

name: The Orcfather
description:
"First, there was law and apparent order. But law's reach was limited. In those untouched corners, there was chaos. Chaos can be exploited, can give unimaginable rewards for those with enough courage and ability. Now rival families struggle for supremacy on the streets. I advice you to step aside, or you could find yourself in a shallow grave. You know, family matters belongs to family..."

The Orcfather is a card game based on a fantasy-themed mafia in which a player's characters can be orcs, elves, ogres, undead, dwarves and more. The players form two mafia families that are confronting one another, and each of the families elects its own "godfather" at the start of the game; the goal of the game is to eliminate the head of the rival family.

Each round starts with a planning phase in which players must secretly prepare the actions they plan to take — attack, defend, or business — but players cannot speak to one another during this phase. They must use their intuition to develop plans as a team, predicting the actions of both allies and enemies. Once all players have decided, they act in order.

While the attack and defend actions are somewhat obvious, for the business action players draw from the business deck, gaining cards that enhance their attacks, potentially save allies from complicated situations, and more.

name: Hämeen Härkätie
description: Finland was part of Swedish kingdom for many centuries. Finnish provincial capital city was Turku. This game is about road from Turku to Hämeenlinna. This road was called Hämeen Härkätie (Oxroad of Häme). In the game players visit 26 notable places along this particular road. If you'll happen stop in any of these locations, there might be tasks for you to accomplish. The main goal of the game is to learn local history and it's offered for schools as a tool for teaching. The basic mechanic of the game is just simple roll and move.  The winner of the game is the first player to reach Hämeenlinna.

name: Töölö
description: This is educational roll and move game about Helsinki city district of Töölö. Players are rolling the dice and moving across the streets of Helsinki. There are 24 places of interest and if players happen to stumble on them, then they must answer some questions. If the player knows the right answer, he/she might get some kind of reward (extra throw of dice, get further). If the player's answer is not correct, he/she might get punished (miss a turn, go backwards). First one to finish is the winner.

name: El Joc de TV3
description:
A trivia/party game based on TV3, Catalonia's public television. It's released to celebrate its 30th anniversary.

It has 1400 questions and challenges, all are about TV3's history.

name: Mr. One Minute Challenge
description: A game from Wilkinson's self-published 'Mr.' range.  The aim of One Minute Challenge is to complete five one-minute long challenges, for example naming forms of transport or types of curry, or memorising a shopping list.  The game comes with a deck of cards each containing a challenge and a sand timer.  A player who successfully completes a challenge keeps the challenge card, and the first player to reach the target number of cards wins.

name: Railroads
description:
Railroads is a train-themed, set collection card game in which players race to match cargo types with stations to collect as many points as possible.

The station cards reveal just enough information to let players know how much effort it will take to claim the card (by listing how much track is needed to reach the station). Using engine cards, players create a train, then load it with cargo cards. The first player to claim a station card flips it over to reveal which cargo is needed; if he delivers the right cargo, he scores bonus points.

As the game progresses, which stations are left and what possible cargo they will need becomes easier to deduce, resulting in competitive and quick plays toward the end of each game-playing session.

name: Beer Nerd
description: The Beer Nerd™ game is a beer tasting game from the creators of the Winerd® game. Taste 3 beers at the start then answer trivia questions and take blind tastes to advance. Think you know your beers? Then Put Your Beer Where Your Mouth Is!

name: Battroborg
description:
Battroborgs are motion controlled battling robots that are built for combat and fueled by your fists.

Players control their robots via handheld nunchuck style remotes. Robot punches correspond to each human punch and move the robot forward.  A solid blow to the face scores a point and is shown via led.  The first to score five points wins as their opponent becomes disabled.

name: Par Terre et Par Mer
description: Roll and move game with a travel theme published in France (1880 - 1900). Players visit exotic locations and world Capitals. Starting and ending in France.

name: Rundfunkspiel
description:
This is a simple roll-and-move game. Some spaces on the game board have special radio-themed meanings, which are explained in the game rules.

The first Player to reach space 70 wins the game.

name: Crypt Crashers
description:
Crypt Crashers:
  Cooperative Board Game
  1-5 players
  45 minute play time

Crypt Crashers is a highly thematic cooperative board game. Players take turns exploring the crypt and collect clues. If they select the right clues, they will reveal the location of hidden treasure. As the game progresses, mummies and giant spiders begin to awaken. The players must work together and be quick. Time is running out.

Crypt Crashers has nine levels of difficulty and 8 different expeditions to keep the players challenged.

name: Snowball Wars
description:
Snowball Wars has simplified game mechanics and the player usually controls a team of combatants. Events occur to interrupt the regular game by way of Wildcards drawn from a deck of cards whenever the attacker and defender roll the same number during combat.

Snowball Wars is a Print and Play minigame complete with full rules, figures, terrain, bases, game tiles and game cards.

You will need a colour printer, cutting tools, glue, foamcore and time. Assembly instructions are included.  
a great introduction to tactical gaming for little ones.

Nominated for the 2012 Ennies Best Miniature Product Award

name: Katana Schoolgirls vs Zombie Furries
description:
The objective of this game is to hunt down and destroy the monsters and collect gear. Each opponent and gear has a point cost that is added at the end of the game to determine the winner. Objectives can shift during the game depending on the game scenario you are playing and your character’s Dark Secret motivation.

Minigame complete with full rules, game tiles and game cards. This is a layered PDF giving you four options of colours and a horde of zombies. There are 94 possible miniatures in this set!

You will need a colour printer, cutting tools, glue, foamcore and time. Assembly instructions are included.

Nominated for the 2012 Ennies Best Miniature Product Award

name: Fief: France 1429
description:
Fief: France 1429 is a game of dynastic ambition in which players assume the roles of nobles in the 15th century kingdom of France. Each player strives to become the most powerful ruling force in the kingdom by gaining control of Fief and Bishopric territories. In turn, they acquire Royal and Ecclesiastical (church) titles which give their families influence to elect the next Pope and King. Players strengthen their positions by negotiating marriage alliances between their families, setting the stage for love, treachery and deception!

Fief is a classic French-language game and is being re-introduced by Academy Games in English with updated rules, new units, a new and larger consolidated map, and more. This edition also includes additional components, which enhances game play.
 The game board represents a portion of the Kingdom of France in the Middle Ages. Villages have square outlines that are connected by roads that allow Lord and Troop movement. The villages are grouped into eight colored background areas that represent individual Fiefs, which are domains given to Lords to preside over. Fiefs have different colored backgrounds and Bishoprics have heavy bordered outlines that include several different Fiefs. Each village also belongs to one of five church Bishoprics; each Bishopric is outlined with a heavy border line and is numbered between 1-5 along the edge of the board inside a Bishop's Mitre.

Each player controls up to four family members, comprised of male and female nobles. These family members will rise in power by gaining Royal and Ecclesiastic Titles.

In Fief: France 1429, a player may attempt to gain control of all the villages in a Fief to gain the Royal Title of Baron, Earl or Duke. For each Fief a player controls, he gains 1 VP. These Titled Lords may now take part in the election for the next King. They may even be a candidate to become King, thus bringing 1 VP and more power to the family! Other members of your family may follow the calling of the Church to gain the Ecclesiastical Titles of Bishop and then Cardinal. These titles allow you to Tithe Bishoprics, taking the Church's (i.e. "your") fair share of income from other Fief Lords! The highest goal your clerical family member can attain is to be elected Pope, bringing 1 VP and special privileges to your family!
 You win the game as soon as you have 3 VPs. This is easier said than done and you may need to form alliances with other players through diplomacy and marriage to obtain your goal. When one of your family members marries a noble of another family, the two of you become allied. You now win the game together with 4 VPs and cannot win alone, unless your marriage is annulled by the Pope or your spouse is "mysteriously" murdered or dies of some other foul means!

In addition to being wary of your fellow players, you may draw event cards that can quickly change your destiny. Bounty Event cards are beneficial to the Player and include "Good Harvest", "Good Weather" and "Added Taxes" cards. But some cards are Disaster Cards that can randomly effect all players in specific Bishoprics. These include "The Plague", "Heavy Rain", "Famine", and "Peasant Uprisings"!

Income can be increased by players imposing church tithes on their opponent's villages or taxing their own Fiefs. Players may purchase new Fief titles, improve their village incomes with mills, and fortify their cities.

Players will also need to protect their land and castles. Men at Arms and Knights can be purchased, as well as Siege Engines. If you feel that other players are not running their Fiefs as well as you can, you may try to invade their territories! But you must risk one of your family members to lead the troops into possible battle, where they might be killed or taken prisoner. If two opposing armies are in the same village square, a Battle may be initiated. The players assess the size and strength of their armies, which determine the number of Battle Dice each may roll. Each "f" rolled is a hit. Men at Arms are defeated with one hit, while Knights require three hits to be removed from the battle.

The Kickstarter Edition of Fief: France 1429 included the Fief: France 1429 Expansions Pack and offered 3-D buildings and metal coins as 'add ons.' These items are all still available directly from Academy Games.

This game is the most recent edition of Fief. It re-implements: 

    Fief (first original edition, 1981)
    Fief 2 (second edition with updated rules, 1989)
    Fief (third edition with completely revised rules and material, 2011)

name: Manifest
description:
It's the roaring '20s and there's a fortune to be made steaming across the wild oceans. To succeed, you'll need a captain's steady nerve and the help of Lady Luck to land your cargo where it's needed. You have ships full of passengers and precious cargo, but can you outrun pirate robbers, terrifying storms and a stock market crash that might devalue your goods?

Manifest is a game of cargo ships, sea scoundrels, and nautical mayhem. Win points for your shipping company by completing Contracts. Pick up the required goods or passengers at their source, then navigate the high seas to deliver them to their destination. With a choice of private and public contracts and multi-purpose action cards, there are many paths to victory, and some "take that" options to make sure your opponents don't steal the limelight.

Manifest can be played in two ways: Standard and Expert. The Standard game is the introductory and family game. The Expert game builds on this, with a deck-buying and building mechanism replacing the blind card draw, thus adding another level of strategy that confident players may prefer.

name: Res-Q
description:
From the rules:
--==--
Res-Q is a collectable card game based of amazing real rescues carried out in New Zealand, designed by a Rescue Helicopter Pilot.

A fun part of this game is simply collecting the cards of different and unusual scenarios, all of which actually happened.

There are 8 packs, each consisting of 18 different scenarios and a Miracle card and a Good Weather card. Look for an Unusual card - there's one in every 360 cards and a Very Unusual card - there's one in every 720 cards. Collect them to increase your odds of winning.

The object of Res-Q is to save the 'patient' and thereby win cards.
--==--

Each card has 2 functions:

1. Scenario 
2. Equipment, vehicles and personnel

Each player in turn chooses a scenario and the other player plays equipment etc. Then the scenario card is flipped and points allocated from the played cards. If the requisite points have been reached the scenario is successfully completed. The player who is successful takes all the cards as points.

name: Brockenfahrt  Eine Reise durch den schönen Harz
description:
Objective: be the first ending on space 89
- moving by turns -
simple 'Roll & Move' game - roll the die, move forward & follow instructions printed on lid inside if you end on a marked space.

Remarks:
Belongs to series: "Scholz' künstlerische Spiele";
Likely published ~1920s
Movers: pewter figures

name: Makler Giełdowy
description:
Makler GieÅ‚dowy is a Monopoly with a twist. The board is very similar (there is a marketplace on the board). The theme is almost the same but instead of buying properties, players buy shares of companies.

On his turn, a player rolls one die and moves that number of spaces around the board. If the player lands on an as-yet-unowned company share, he has the opportunity to buy it and add it to his portfolio (there is no option to auction it). The more shares of one company a player owns, the more profit he will gain when any other player lands on the company. There are no houses or hotels in this game.

There are other places on the board which can not be bought, but instead require the player to draw a card and perform the action on the card, pay taxes or collect income.

The main difference between Makler GieÅ‚dowy and Monopoly is the marketplace. Every time the player passes by the marketplace, he can go to it. Depending on the number thrown on the die the player may buy 1, 2, 3 or 4 shares. Selling is unlimited. Just before acquiring the player draws a market card which shows the price change. The share may be more or less expensive. It is possible to buy every unowned share in the game. It is not possible to buy shares from another players or sell them. There is no negotiation in this game and the trading is allowed only through the marketplace.

The game ends when first player goes bankrupt. The most wealthy player is declared the winner. There is also a variant when the game ends when all but one player go bunkrupt.

name: Funny or Die
description:
Funny or Die consists double sided cards featuring a funny picture on one side and a caption on the other. Each player has a hand of these cards with the remainder making up the deck. An active player rolls a die which determines both the money wagered on the round and if the round will use pictures, captions, or the player's choice. A card is drawn from the deck for each player, who must then pair it with an opposite card from their hand.

In the voting round, each player has a funny token and a die token with identical backs. Players place a funny token on the funniest pair and a die token on the least funny (players may not vote for themselves). A tie leads to a run-off vote. The tokens are flipped up and the player with the most funny tokens takes the money wagered. The next player then rolls the die for a new round.

When a player loses all their money, the game ends. The player with the most money wins the game.

name: Dodge a Dinosaur
description: The cavemen are out hunting but there is danger around every corner. You must help your caveman to avoid danger by keeping them as far away from the T-Rex as possible! The winner is not the first person to reach the end, instead you must use a little luck and the playing cards to dodge danger and avoid reaching the T-Rex's lair.

name: Íslandssöguspilið
description:
Íslandssöguspilið is at it's base a roll & move game, with some cards that help you affect other players, by slowing them down or moving their pawns back.

From the back of the box:
An exciting race through Icelandic history. Take part in a race through Icelandic history from the Age of Settlement to the current era. Learn about the persons and events that have shaped the country and it's people.

name: Escaletto: Das neue Rechenspiel
description: Each player has 5 meeples. To win the game the players must get them from the spaces 1-5 to the spaces 41-45 and then roll a 1 to get them on the colored triangle. To move their meeples one space they must roll a number by which the number on the space above them can be divided. This way more than one meeple can be moved per turn. If a 1 is rolled, all five meeples can move.

name: Horch Memory
description:
Pick up two of the face-down tin cans, shake each one. If the sounds are identical, you have a matching pair, keep it, and search for the next pair.
The 12 pairs of tin cans have transparent covers, each pair contains different seeds of different size, weight (and color, though the latter does not play a big role here – one could use it also as a standard memory game for hearing-impaired people, of course). Some similar sized seeds produce VERY similar sounds, so the game is not at all easy.
The game box also contains a booklet explaining the different seeds in detail (it unfortunately does not explain the game rules, but then any one familiar with Memory games will not need any explanation).
"Horch" is kind of an old-fashioned German word for "Listen!".

name: The Lord of the Rings: The Return of the King Deck-Building Game
description:
Game description from the publisher:

In The Lord of the Rings: The Return of the King Deck-Building Game, you take on the role of Frodo, Legolas, Aragorn, or one of their brave and heroic allies in the struggle against the forces of the Dark Lord Sauron! While you begin armed only with the courage of the free peoples of Middle-earth, you will add new, more powerful cards to your deck as you go. Your goal is to defeat the deadly forces that serve Sauron as you make way towards Mount Doom to destroy The One Ring.

Each player takes on the role an iconic hero from The Lord of the Rings: The Return of the King including Aragorn, Éowyn, King Théoden, Legolas & Gimli, Frodo & Samwise, Merry, or Pippin. Each hero comes with a special card unique to that character and usable only by that player.

Each player starts with his own basic ten-card deck and draws a hand of five cards each turn. Power is the currency you will use to buy new, stronger cards to add to your deck. The goal of a deck-building game is to craft your personal deck into a well-oiled machine with the six types of cards that can be acquired: Enemies, Allies, Artifacts, Maneuvers, Fortunes, and Locations. When a player has amassed enough Power, he may defeat more powerful enemies from the "Archenemy" deck, including Shelob, The Witch-King, and the Eye of Sauron! Each card acquired during the game has a Victory Point (VP) value with the Archenemy cards providing the most VPs. In the end, whoever has the most VPs wins.

Whether played on its own or combined with the other LotR deck-building games from Cryptozoic, The Lord of the Rings: The Return of the King Deck-Building Game introduces a new feature to the game: a map of "The Journey of the Ring". Can you deliver The One Ring to Mount Doom, then destroy it? Some of the cards you play will move the Ring of Power towards Mount Doom on the map, while the minions of Sauron will delay the Ring on its journey. If you fail to destroy The One Ring, Sauron may be too powerful to overcome...

Cryptozoic's The Lord of the Rings/The Hobbit deck-builder series:


     The Lord of the Rings: The Fellowship of the Ring Deck-Building Game
     The Lord of the Rings: The Two Towers Deck-Building Game
     The Lord of the Rings: The Return of the King Deck-Building Game
     The Hobbit: An Unexpected Journey Deck-Building Game
     The Hobbit: The Desolation of Smaug Deck-Building Game Expansion Pack

The game was inspired by the 1956 documentary movie "Le Monde du silence" by Jacques-Yves Cousteau and the invention of the aqualung.

name: Wheel of Fortune Electronic Game
description:
FROM THE BOX:

The celebrated television game show comes to life in your own living room with this tabletop game! Over 1000 puzzles in your favorite game categories. Tons of fun for friends, families or the ultimate Wheel of Fortune fan!

Just like the show and all other previous version before it you spin the wheel, choose a letter, buy a vowel and solve the puzzle. When the wheel is spun, the seasons 24-26 template scrolls upwards on the LCD screen (and with the gradual movements on the wheel can stop anywhere the player wishes). The game has four rounds including the Jackpot round in round three and the bonus round where you have to spin a  smaller-sized 24 wedge wheel and solve one puzzle in order to claim you prize. It follows the rules from season 26 and wedges like Jackpot, Mystery Wedge, Wild Card, Prize Wedge Million Dollar Wedge, gift tag and free spin (shown as "Free Spin + $300" if the wheel stops) are there. It also has QWERTY Keyboard that can only be used with the included stylus pen. and it featured the voice of the late Charlie O'Donnell as host.

A Platinum Edition of the game was released in 2009.

name: Imperium Chronicles: Heroes of the Imperium Board Game
description:
Note: This game is no longer available. It was superseded by In Harm's Way Tactics which incorporates many of the mechanics of HofI.

Heroes of the Imperium is a cooperative card/board game set in a science fantasy universe called the Imperium Chronicles. Up to five players work together as heroes on missions against the enemies of the Imperium (Solo play is also supported).

Each new game begins with players choosing from one of six hero archetypes: Assassin, Duelist, Grunt, Medic, Officer, and Psi Mage. Each hero is represented by a Stat card listing his attributes and default abilities/attacks. Each hero also has a deck of Ability cards from which the player can choose up to five. Some Ability cards are marked as "Advanced" and count as two cards. This allows players to choose fewer, but more powerful cards if they wish.

Once player have chosen their heroes and Ability cards, they select a mission to be played. Each mission description includes which enemies will be encountered and what goals the player must meet to win. An Encounter deck can also be used (especially for solo players) to randomize which enemies will be fought during the mission.

Each mission also includes a map of the game board. The board consists of several tiles that players assemble prior to the beginning of play. Paper miniatures, representing both heroes and enemies, are placed on the board and moved on a turn-by-turn basis. Each turn allows players to carry out several actions including attacking, movement, and using items. Control of the enemy side is either done by a single player who chose not to have a hero, or by hero players on a rotating basis.

Enemies in the game are grouped into three main factions: the primitive Ferans, slave-trading Ougluks, and the technologically advanced Warlock Industries. Each enemy, like the heroes, has a Stat card listing its attributes and default abilities/attacks. They do not, however, get additional Ability cards.

name: Supermarket Sweep Game
description: Based on the hit ITV game show from 1993-2001 & 2007 with Dale Winton as your host, answer questions correctly and go wild in the aisles as you race to get the most items in your trolleys as possible in order to win.

Armored thrusts are met by guided missiles, APDS rounds, and attack choppers. Defensive positions are pounded by aircraft and artillery, as infantry are all present. Available from MSD Games within the Frontlines Series www.msdgames.com

name: Assault on Stalingrad

From July to October 1942, in the area between the Don and Volga Rivers, the German army broke through the Soviet defense and rushed to Stalingrad. Urban warfare is expanded on the Stalingrad city mini-map.

name: Trolley Ride

"Game of the Trolley Ride" is typical race spin and move game.
First player starting on Washington street, from the station, moves checker as shown by the indicator.
The player first completing the trip around the line, wins the game.

name: Get Wasted
description:
Get Wasted is english version of the czech most popular beer drinking game Chlastej!

Goal of the game:
You are sitting with your friends in a beautiful pub and think what the hell are we going to do? One of you challenges
everybody to a Competition the first who gets lucky at the whore house wins! Everyone is in so the point of this game is clear –

English version Get Wasted is only translation of the popular czech game Chlastej!

name: Bicycle Race
description: The board depicts an oval shaped racetrack divided into spaces. The object of the game is to win the race.

name: The New Electronic Perfect Match Game
description:
FROM THE BOX:

Haven't you always wondered who your perfect match is? The New Perfect Match Game is the fun way to find out. The game is played by couples who are asked a series of questions with four alternative answers supplied. These questions cover topics ranging from sex to politics and the arts. Each partner decides on their favourite response and uses the electronic Perfect Match device to check their compatibility and advance along the board. the first couple to reach the Perfect Match Heart Light are the winners. Who will be your Perfect Match?

Contents:

2 Electronic Perfect Match Devices.
288 Question Cards.
1 Die.
4 Position Markers.
Perfect Match Game Board.

The players are divided into couples. Each couple takes a position marker and places it in the start square. Remove the perfect match cards from their perforations and place them in their marked positions on the game board.

The Perfect Match Cards:
These cards are divided into two categories: pink 'Girls' cards and blue 'Guys' cards. As the game proceeds, question cards are taken from the 'Girls' pile if the playing couple lands on a pink square or From the 'Guys' pile if they land on a blue square. Each card contains one questions with four alternative
answers marked A,B,C or D.

Choosing the right answer:
If the couple lands on a blue square, one of the other players picks up a 'Guys' card and directs one question on it to the male partner. He must choose the alternative which he feels is most appropriate to him. His partner must try to anticipate his feelings or attitudes on that question and choose the same alternative. Couples should be open and honest in their choice of answer. Similarly, if the couple lands on a pink square, a 'Girls' card would be taken and its question directed towards the female partner. She will choose and answer and her partner should try to anticipate this response.

Questions marked 'BOTH' are  designed to test compatibility, with each partner choosing their own favourite answer in response to the question asked.

Using the Electronic Perfect Match device:
These devices are in the shape of four hearts joined together. Each heart is labeled A,B,C or D, representing the four alternatives on the Perfect Match question cards. When a question is asked and each partner has silently decided on which alternative to choose, they each hold up their device with the chosen representative letter uppermost. They must not allow each other to see their choices. The two devices are then pressed together. If the electronic tone sounds, a perfect match has been achieved for that question.

Dare Cards:
Scattered throughout both packs of cards are Dare Cards. If one these cards appears, the couple must perform whatever is required of them according to the instructions on the card. Their performance is adequate (as indicated by a show of hands) then the couple may roll the die again and continue their turn. Be warned - if you are too easy on others then there is no challenge to perform well. If you are too tough, then your opponent will be equally tough on you. So be fair!

Playing the game: Each couple rolls the die once and those with the highest score start, moving their marker the corresponding number of squares. One of the other players then reads the first question to the starting couple. If the couple achieves a Perfect Match, they roll the die again and advance the corresponding number of squares along the board. Remember, a couple can only roll the die and advance after  they have successfully answered a Perfect Match question or performed a Dare task. The couple continues in this way until they are unsuccessful in either a Perfect Match question or a Dare performance, in which case the control of the game is handed over to the next couple (moving clockwise).

Winning the Game:
The first couple to reach the Perfect Match Heart Light and then successfully achieve a Perfect Match from their Choice of either a Girls or Guys question will be declared the winner.


    Special Note


Should the electronic tone stop working use a nail file or a similar tool to lever apart the two case sections of the blue device. Carefully removed the battery, replacing it with one of identical type. Be sure to position it positive side up. When pressing the case sections back together, locate the letter "A" on the plastic cover over the battery position.

Based on the formerly popular 1980s Network Ten (and much later Seven Network in 2002) Australian TV dating game show of the same name.

name: Chetyrestan

In the Glorious Republic of Chetyrestan, Comrades are being assigned different accommodations to live in. Players are government planners giving a place to stay to everyone while trying to create a peaceful and functional city.

The players place/move Buildings and Comrades trying to get 4 Buildings or 4 Comrades of the same colour in an orthogonal or diagonal row multiple times to create a functional district in Chetyrograd (in order to get rewards).

name: Basari: Das Kartenspiel
description:
Basari: Das Kartenspiel keeps the fundamentals of Basari and its sister game Edel, Stein & Reich.

Every round in Basari: Das Kartenspiel, each player is dealt a bazaar card that shows a number of gemstones, victory points, and workers. Players simultaneously choose their action for that turn, which is one of the following:


     Draw an additional bazaar card to get more workers
     Score VPs shown on the bazaar card they received this turn
     Take the gems shown on the bazaar card they received this turn


If only one player chooses a specific action, she takes that action. If exactly two players choose the same action, those players will barter for that action: offering increasingly valuable gems to one another for that action. One of the players will take the gems offered, the other player will take the action. If three or more players choose the same action, the action is forfeited.

Players keep all the cards they are dealt, and the round ends if one or more players have 15 workers on their cards after all negotiations and actions have been completed. Each player with 15 or more workers scores 12 VPs. The player(s) with the most gems of each color score additional VPs, but then must return some of their gems back to the bank.

Each player keeps their leftover gems, the cards are shuffled together, and a new round starts.

After three rounds, the game ends. Whoever has the most victory points wins!

name: Meine erste BrainBox: Die Welt entdecken
description:
From the publisher:
The object of the game is to win as many cards as possible in ten minutes. The first player takes a card from the Brainbox and turns the timer over. The player then has ten seconds to study the picture on the card. When the timer runs out the card is passed to player two and player one rolls the die to see which question is to be asked. The questions are on the reverse of the picture card. Player Two checks the answer by looking at the picture and if it is correct the card is given back to Player One to keep. If the answer is wrong the card is placed back into the Brainbox and the next player chooses a card. Please remember, the answer to the question is on the picture side of the card, so look carefully! The player with the most cards after ten minutes wins! If there is a tie, it's sudden death with both players choosing a card and having to answer all eight questions on the card. The player who answers the most correctly wins! For 1 player Look at the card as above for ten seconds. Then turn the card over and answer all the questions (use a pen and paper to record the answers). If all questions are answered correctly the card is kept. If any answers are incorrect, the card has to be put back in the Brainbox. See how many cards you have after five or ten minutes.

name: The Big Bang Theory: Ultimate Genius Party Game
description:
THE BIG BANG THEORY Ultimate Genius Party Game features 4 different game challenges, each inspired from some of THE BIG BANG THEORY'S funniest moments.  Players are divided into 2-4 teams and roll a special die each turn to determine which game they will play. These games include Counterfactuals, Fun with Flags, Sketch Charades, and Celebrity.

In Counterfactuals, a member of the opposite team will draw a card that suppose a world that is different from our own in one key aspect, and asks a question about that world.  The competing teammates must choose from multiple-choice answers, and gain points if their answers match each other's, as well as if they match the game writers' answer.

The goal in Fun with Flags is for a player to guess flags from a deck of cards based on clues given by a teammate.  The twist is that there are 3 Oops Words that the Clue-Giver cannot say.

Sketch Charades is a simple drawing game, where one teammate will draw a card with a phrase, then has to draw it for another teammate to guess.

Finally, Celebrity is a charades game, in which one teammate is chosen to be the Actor and all the other teammates are the Guessers.  An opposing team chooses answers for each of 5 categories for the Actor to act out.

name: Marital Bliss
description:
At the start of the two-player card game Marital Bliss, each player draws seven missions that they must complete in secret for their partner over the next seven days. Mission cards range from housework chores (such as taking out the trash) to more complex activities such as organizing a weekend away. Each mission card also has a brownie point option that can be completed for extra points.

Players can choose to discard any number of mission cards at the start of the game if they feel they cannot complete them. Different missions are worth a different number of points, and any uncompleted missions at the end of the week are worth negative points. If the other player guesses a mission you are attempting (or recently completed), then you gain no points for the mission.

Strategy cards are mixed with the mission cards and allow players to change the rules of the game by making the other player discard missions, allowing some free guesses, or simply gaining points for a guessed mission.

Players also draw five reward cards and choose the one they would most like to win. A players cards are keep secret from their opponent.

The player with the most points at the end of the week earns a reward card to be used at their discretion.

name: Bulls & Cows
description:
Bulls and Cows is an old code-breaking mind or paper and pencil game for two or more players, predating the similar commercially marketed board game Mastermind.

It is a game with numbers or words that may date back a century or more. It is played by two opponents.

The goal is to be the first player to successfully decode your opponent's secret number or word. Each player secretly writes a four-digit number or four-letter word. The digits or letters must all be different. Players take turns trying to guess their opponent's number/word. The opponent tells them the number of matches.

Right number, wrong place is a "cow." Right number, right place is a "bull."

If the person who took the first turn is also the first to decode the secret number or word, the other person gets one more turn to see if they can tie.

name: Warcard: Afganistan
description:
Warcard: Afganistan is a two player card game. One player will play as Talibans, the other as a group of Polish soldiers who get ambushed by the Afghans.

Before the game each player will pick several characters that will represent his forces. The goal of the game is to gain victory points by killing the opponents characters. Stronger characters will be of more use during the game but will also give the opponent more points once killed.

The game lasts four rounds and each round last three phases:

- Straighten + draw phase
Each player straightens his characters so he can use them in the new round. Also each player draws cards until they have four cards in hand.

- Action phase
In the action phase players can perform actions until both of them decide to pass. For an action they can play a card from their hand (events or attachments), use an ability of a character or shoot using one of their characters. Each character can shoot once per action phase. 
When a character shoots players form an "exchange fire" pool by adding into it two "miss" cards and as many "hit" cards as is indicated on the shooting characters card. Now players can manipulate the "exchange fire" pool by playing cards that add either "hit" or "miss" cards. When both players don't want to play anymore cards they randomly pick one card from the pool. If it is a "miss" nothing happens, if it is a "hit"  the shot character loses one life point. If his life points are reduced to 0 he dies and victory points are awarded.

- Discard phase
Each player may discard one card from his hand.

After the fourth round the player with the most victory points wins the game.

If players own more than one copy of Warcard: Afganistan they can build their own decks before the game.

name: Space-mission: Zanathar
description:
A roll-and-move race to the finish for two players, Space-mission: Zanathar incorporates two types of pieces for each player and luck-based battles on the way to the central goal of "Zanathar," where the first player to land his Command ship and two Star ships will win the game.

Each player has one Command ship and eight Star Ships. The board has each player entering from a different side and spiraling from one numbered base to another toward the central goal. What moves each player makes depends on the roll of a die. Moves include continuing forward towards the goal, combat with one of the opponent's pieces, starting over at the beginning, or overshooting the goal and re-orbiting nearby for another attempt.

name: Autorennen
description: The objective of this car race is to be the first player to reach the finish line. The movement of the cars is determined by a number die. On certain spaces on the track a color die is used to decide, if the result of the number die can be used or if the player has to skip the turn. On space 56 a black result on the color die eliminates the player from the game (carcrash). The game was published in the 1950s.

name: Weltraum-Station Nr. 1
description:
The objective of the game is to get 2 meeples (spaceships) from the starting area to the space station in the center of the board and back to earth on the opposite side of the board. The spaces on the board are holes. Below the board there is a rotating disk with some more holes in it. If a meeple falls in a hole it has to start at the beginning again. Whenever a meeple gets on a space of it's own color, the player has to rotate the disk in a direction of his choice. Thereby the player changes the color of the spaces and the postion of the holes, which may cause some meeples to fall back to earth. The winner is the player who is the first to get both meeples to the landing area.
  
The game was published in the 1950s.

name: Quad Kingdom Chess
description:
Quad Kingdom Chess is a chess variant for two to four players, utilizing a standard chess board with two rows added to each side (called a Kingdom) for the players' starting positions, and with a line of pawn promotion much drawn between squares six rows out from each Kingdom.  Players need only reach the square adjoining the line for promotion--crossing it is not necessary.  Four squares of empty space at each corner of the board are called Towers and are not in the field of play.

The goal of the game is to force an opponent's King into Checkmate.  Each player has his own colored set of standard Chess pieces, which move and capture the same as in ordinary Chess, but for a few variations related to this multiplayer adaptation, including an optional point system.

name: Gold-Gräber
description: The goal of the game is to eliminate all other players and be the last with a tent on the board. To accomplish this, the players have to search for gold and steal tents from each other. The tents are moved by the roll of a die. If a tent reaches a space with an opposing tent, it's put over this tent and has captured it. Captured tents can be freed by the same maneuver. Freed and captured tents can be secured or released by taking them to one's base camp. Tents arriving at the gold claim at the center of the board get one goldnugget. For 3 nuggets a player can get a captured tent back.

name: Tippin' Toadstool
description:
From box:

TUMBLIN' FUMBLIN' FUN!
It's fun, it's unpredictable... It's Tippin' Toadstool! Can you get rid of your leaves without tipping the frog? Add one leaf at a time to the teetering toadstool and see it being to grow and sway as more leaves are placed. The first player to place all their leaves in the Tippin' Toadstool without tipping the frog, WINS!

name: Sveriges Mästerkock
description:
Sveriges Mästerkock is a quiz game with 2000 food questions. The  theme is from the BBC TV show Masterchef. The questions are diveded into 5 categories (Food, Spice, Recipe, Chemistry & Technique, Compote).

The game is played in 3 phases. First the players are divided into two teams answering questions together. When a team has managed to give a correct answer in each of the 5 categories (or 8 correct answers in any categories) then that team is dissolved and each member play separately. The individual players now compete with each other to get to final. The first 2 players that give correct answers on each category get to the final.

The two players in the final individually answers as many questions they can in one minute and the one with the most correct answers is the masterchef and winner.

name: Are You Normal?
description:
The Pressman Are You Normal? Board Game asks questions that reveal funny and honest answers to see where you fit on the normal scale. For instance: Have you ever laughed so hard that something can out of your nose? 100 people were polled for each question to determine what is and what isn't considered normal. Guess and bet on answers to ramp up the fun while discovering where you and your friends land on the scale. Based on the short-lived 2012 OWN (Oprah Winfrey Network) TV game show Are You Normal, America? hosted by Barry Poznick and Kim Coles.

Object:
If 2 Players, be the first player to reach 20 points.

If 3 Players, be the first player to reach 30 points.

If 4 Players, be the first player to reach 40 points.

If 5 players, be the first player to reach 50 points.

If 6 Players, be the first player to reach 60 points.

Contents:
Game board, 200 question cards, 42 tokens, 12 voting cards (6 yes, 6 no), scorepad.

Set Up:
Each player takes the 7 tokens of the Yes/No color zero near them and one "Yes" and one "No" voting card of that same color. Mix the question cards and place them face down, in reaching distance of all players. One player takes the score sheet to keep track of all the players' scores.

Playing:
The player who claims to be the most "NORMAL" of the group starts the game. Then play moves clockwise. On your turn, read the top question card out loud. All players, including the player who read the card, place their "Yes" or "No" voting card face down in front of them based on their own personal experience: "Yes" if you have or "No" if you have not.

Players now place one of their own tokens on the Yes/No section of all the other players, guessing whether each player said "Yes" or "No" to the action on the question. At the same time all players (except the reader) have to guess what percentage of people who were polled on the question card said "Yes" and place one of their tokens on the percentage circles in the middle of the board that they feel is correct. Starting with the player whose turn it is, reveal your answer and score the points, one for each correct guess for each player and two for each correct guess in the percentage area.

During the game, players have one opportunity to "Double Down", (i.e. place 2 tokens on one of the percentage circles in the middle of the board). After scores have been written, players take back their color tokens and the next player will be the reader.

Ending and Winning the Game:
Play continues until one player accumulates the required amount of points as outlined in the beginning of the rules. Now you will find out who actually is the most "NORMAL".

Game objective is simple; first to the finish line is the winner!

name: Hit or Miss
description:
This game requires one standard deck of cards and only a very small play space.

This is a solitaire card game where the goal is to keep scoring "hits".

Players deal one card at a time, counting from 1 to 13 as they do so. When the rank of a card matches the number counted, it is removed. When a player reaches the end, they start again where they left off, until all cards are removed. If a player goes through the deck twice without scoring a hit the game is over.

name: Battle for Gettysburg: The First Day
description:
Battle for Gettysburg: The First Day

The game comes with one colour map (in two pieces about 22" x 17").

120 counters (mounted not cut), rule book and charts.

Formations (Divisions for the Confederates, Corps for the Union) activate on chit pull, each formation then may Fire, Move and Final Fire with Defensive Fire occurring at the completion of Movement. Artillery can fire out to 6 hexes. Infantry fire at adjacent units.

The unit counters are single sided and the step loss markers are double sided. Rule book is B&W but Play Aid is colour.

There is a set up sheet in B&W that shows the locations/areas where the units that start on map are placed.

name: Noodle Speedoodle

Spin the spinner to determine the style of play, pick a noodle, pick a card and choose a word to draw, flip the timer and draw! Guess correctly and everyone wins!

name: Say the Word

In this cooperative game, take a zany character, some silly words, and an offbeat challenge, then put them all together one phrase or sentence at a time. Can't recall a word? Have the other players "charade" it for you. Repeat the story start to finish for the big win!

Launch 3 Bird figures at once with the Lightsaber launcher for an epic Bird-on-Pig assault! Can you topple the Imperial oinkers? Destroy the Empire, then set the blocks up and destroy it again!

name: Password Lightning Round Card Game

name: The Gruffalo: Hide and Seek Mini Game
description: A mini board game that children can ‘race’ to find where The Gruffalo characters are hiding. If they find where The Gruffalo himself is hiding too, then they win the game. The object of the game is to be the first player to correctly identify all of his or her character cards and identify the Gruffalo hiding in the deep dark wood.

name: Doodle Quest

Dive under the deep blue sea where you'll find fish to gobble, treasure to discover, and divers to save!

In the line-drawing game Doodle Quest, players study challenging quest cards, then try to replicate the depicted path(s) on their separate transparent doodle sheets. Once finished, the players place their doodle sheets on top of the quest card to see whether the drawings line up. Visit starfish for bonus points! Doodle Quest includes 36 illustrations with two different levels of play: beginning and advanced.

Doodle Quest features the same basic gameplay as in Loony Quest, but has been developed differently by the publisher.

name: Penguin
description:
Penguin is a fast-paced game in which players stack colored plastic penguins that they draw at random from a bag at the start of the game. Players keep their penguins behind screens so that no one knows who has which colors.

On a turn, a player adds a penguin to the pyramid. The first penguins are placed in the bottom row (obviously), but once two penguins are adjacent, a penguin matching the color of either of those penguins can be placed on top of them; e.g., either a red or blue penguin can be placed on top of adjacent red and blue penguins. The bottom row can be no more than seven penguins long. If a player knocks down the pyramid, he takes penalty points equal to the number of penguins behind his screen, then players start again from scratch. When a player can't play — whether because he has no penguins at all or no penguins that can legally be played — he passes. Once all players pass, the round ends and everyone scores one penalty point for each of his unplayed penguins. Anyone who played all of his penguins returns two penalty points.

After playing as many rounds as the number of players, the game ends and whoever has the highest score wins.

name: Connect 4: Dunk
description:
Summary:

The game consists of a tower with an funnel on top and two catapults. One player plays yellow, the other red. Both players now try to shoot their disks into the tower. The first player to sink his/her four disks wins the round, the first player to win three rounds or get four disks in a row is the winner of the game.

---

Attack the tower
With this intense version of the classic CONNECT 4 game, even the most confident players will be challenged. Launch your discs into the tower and take down your opponent by being the first to sink four shots. For an even greater test of your speed and strategy, race to line up four discs in a row. You’ll have a blast with this rapid game with two levels of difficulty, but there is only room for one champion in this head-to-head shootout.

Bring it on!
Get ready to test your skill and speed with this fast-paced version of the classic CONNECT 4 game. Develop your strategy for your disc launcher placement and slam-dunk your discs directly into the game tower. Be prepared for a head-to-head shootout with your opponent as you master the rapid-fire action. Keep collecting and shooting discs until you sink four discs to win a round. Winner of three rounds wins the game or you can amp up the action and win instantly by placing 4 discs in a row! Do you have what it takes to be the champion?

Ready, set, launch!
It takes strategy and speed to go head-to-head with your opponent as you aim and fire your discs into the CONNECT 4 tower. Develop strategic locations for your disc launcher and master the rapid-fire action in order to bring down your opponent in this intense game of CONNECT 4 DUNK. The tower’s release lever lets you collect your discs easily and quickly for continued rapid fire. A handy scoring marker is built right into the disc launcher. Win three rounds for the long win or get four discs in a row for an instant win.

Includes 5 red discs, 5 gold discs, tower, 2 legs, 2 feet, 2 launchers, 2 funnels, release lever, and label sheet.

Features:
• Tower structure amps up the need for speed and strategy in this challenging version of the classic CONNECT 4 game!
• Individual disc launchers provide quick release for fast-paced action!
• Defeat your opponent by winning three rounds or win instantly by getting four discs in a row into the tower!
• Tower is easy to set up and comes with stickers for decorating.
• Remove the funnel from the top of the tower for an even bigger challenge!

name: Collusion
description:
Collusion is a mobile-enhanced board game that mandates lying, stealing, cheating, and murdering in order to win. Players must work together while simultaneously plotting against each other in order to gain influence over the region. Selling out an ally to an enemy, blackmailing an opponent, or paying another agent to carry out an assassination on your behalf is all in a day's work.

You play as a Spy Master from one of several agencies. Your goal is to maximize your influence over the region at the expense of the other agencies. How you go about that is not important to your superiors - just don’t get exposed!

Using your advanced espionage device (your phone) you can secretly send messages to other players, hack into their devices, disrupt their gameplay, order assassinations on the black market. While an AI adapts the gameplay based on in-game allegiances, the cards in each player's hands and their current missions. All while managing your agents on the board to carry out your secret objectives and obtain intel.

name: Pinke Pinke
description:
Objective:
Using a board similar to Backgammon collect the most money after all others go bankrupt.

- acting by turns -
Roll 2 dice: correspondent to result place money on related (empty) space (2-12); if concerned space is already filled up earn that money.

Special rules: space 3 must be filled by all other player except active one; a '2' offers additional choices - split or pay. If you've collected money you may roll the dice again

A '12' lets you earn all money in between spaces 4-11, or (worst case) fill them up.

Remarks:
Game was played already during the age of the mercenaries (~1600's); 'PINKE' means money or dough (coins only).

name: Spot it! Preschool

name: Just4Fun Colours

Players play cards to occupy coloured fields on a map. A player wins by owning 4 directly adjacent fields horizontally, vertically or diagonally. If no player wins after 20 rounds, the player who owns the largest contiguous area (number of horizontally and vertically related fields) is declared the winner.

There is the version for 2-4 players, with bigger package (also bigger board and cards), colored (but same sized !) playing tiles :

Just4Fun.

name: Gartenglück
description:
Everything grows and prospers, butterflies and snails crawl happily around the garden. Two funny game ideas where you should remember where all your little garden friends have hidden to collect as many clovers as possible.

Two spring-like memory games for 2-4 players. Contents: 1 die, 9 cloverleaves and 9 round garden friend cards.

You start by rolling a die. The die indicates who are the three garden friends you have to search for now:
On the die appears a color? Search for the snail, the flower and the butterfly of this color.
On the die appears the snail, the flower or the butterfly? Search for the corresponding friend in all three colors (pink, yellow and blue).

If you can locate your three cards you receive a cloverleaf as reward. The game ends as a player has collected three cloverleaves. This player wins the game.

name: Glücks Reiter
description:
The game is about luck. Gather as many stones as you can.

The board is filled with color marked stones. The marks are face down. The position of the 'Glücksreiter' is crucial. It it is on the same color as the stone just moved, you loose your stones. If not you get an extra stone.

The player collecting the most stones, wins.

name: Alaska Oil Game
description:
"A Family Game Filled With Fun and Facts."  Alaska Oil Game was published by Theme Games of Saratoga, California, with copyright in 1978 by M.A. Welsh.

Alaska Oil Game is a racing game in which 2-4 players compete to move all four of their oil barrels from the oil wells in Prudhoe Bay to their oil tankers in Port Valdez. Movement is based on drawing cards of two types: Oil Moving Cards and Pumping Station Cards. Oil Moving Cards are used to follow a longer, circuitous route, while the Pumping Station Cards use the Trans-Alaska Pipeline system that runs straight down the board for potential shortcuts. Oil Movement Cards can be drawn on any space of the board, while Pumping Station Cards may only be drawn on Pumping Station spaces.

The 52 Oil Movement Cards contain 35 movement cards with values ranging from +1 to +10, 11 themed Go Back cards with values from -2 to -9, 3 themed No Move cards, 1 Go Back to Start card and 1 Advance token to Port Valdez card.

There are 52 Pumping Station Cards, each displaying a pumping station numbered 1-12.  Pumping Station 1 is in Prudhoe Bay while Pumping Station 12 is in Port Valdez. When drawn, the player's barrel moves to that pumping station, even if that sends the barrel in the wrong direction.

The first player to move all 4 barrels to their tanker is declared the winner.

name: K-Blort
description: K-Blort is a nod to classic arcade games of the past where quick thinking and strategic game play are the keys to victory. Move your K-Blort around the pyramid capturing cubes while your opponents do the same. Think 5 steps ahead, use special tokens to block enemy progress, and access warps to secure the most cubes.

name: Xoom Cubes

The fast, exciting word game that is easy to learn, quick-to-play and fun for all!

Roll your dice, think fast, slide your letters into words and be first to grab the flag to win the round.

Build a five letter-word, spell the name of someone in the room or create a crossword pattern that uses all of your letters.  Discover many ways to play, and have even more fun creating your own challenges.  The fun you will have is limited only by your imagination.

Xoom Cubes is perfect for parties, family gatherings, game nights, and more, bringing smiles and laughter to all.  It is so much fun, everyone wins!

--from publisher

Contains 56 Dice (4 colors, 14 in each color), and a flag

name: Pasture 51: They Came for our Angus
description:
In this game, players are farmers making a living in infamous Pasture 51, where talk of extraterrestrial activity runs high, and cattle are often rumored to disappear.  Farmers are full of it, and are always trying to top each others' stories of what they have seen; some of it credible, and some of it less so.  You will attempt to weave the most credible UFO story!

Mechanically, Pasture 51 is a stock (get it?) holding game, where players will decide which cattle they wish to hold while also deciding which cattle are legitimately abducted (adding to the credibility of the stories), which cattle simply pass away in the fields, and which cattle are involved in abduction hoaxes (which hurts the credibility of the stories).  There is one pasture card on the table for each of these outcomes, where cattle will graze before meeting their fate.

On a player's turn, he will draw two livestock tokens from a bag, with livestock coming in four varieties.  He will choose one to keep in his personal stock, and one to put below a pasture card of his choice.

The backs of these tokens all contain special abilities as well.  When a token is put out into pasture, it is flipped into the air.  If it lands cattle-side up, too bad, no special ability.  If it lands ability-side up, the player will get to perform an ability such as moving a cattle to an adjacent pasture, swapping a cattle from his personal stock with one in the pastures, or witnessing an abduction, which moves a cattle token from grazing in the pasture up onto the pasture card, where it is locked for the rest of the game.  Abducting cattle while they are in the right pastures will be key to your success!

After a set number of turns, players will determine the value of each cattle variety.  Cattle involved in hoaxes will decrease that variety's value, while those that were abducted by the real deal will add to it.  Players then compare their personal holdings against the value of each cattle variety, with most points weaving the most credible tale!

name: Garden Trade: The card game
description:
You are a merchant who buys fruits from gardeners and sells them to customers in the market. Each turn you choose one of the following actions:

1) Buy one fruit from a gardener
2) Sell any number of fruits to customers
3) Draw a card and adjust pricing in market
4) Manage (swap) customer queue

The player who makes the most money from trading wins !

Most of the time when each player buys or sells any card, it will affect other players because the other players have to wait longer to buy or sell to get a decent price. And every game turn, there will be change in pricing which will cause each player to change their tactic dynamically otherwise player can lose opportunity to make money from trading efficiently.

So there is no down time in the game because even during other player's turn, you must carefully watch out for change in pricing and decide on your own next tactic!

It is designed for 2 - 5 players and end within 20 minutes. 
Fast and dynamically tactical game play.

name: Assemblage of Eternity
description:
Assemblage of Eternity brings the competitive feel of fighting games to the traditional gaming arena, and much like its digital counterpart AOE is designed for 2-4 players in either 1v1, 2v2, Scramble, or Tag modes.

After selecting their favorite combatant, each player attempts to reduce his opponent's life to zero before going to time. The game is, at its foundation, a strong game of rock/paper/scissors with the advantage of being able to mitigate and reverse engineer your opponent's capabilities. Assemblage of Eternity is built to give players who know everything about the game a huge advantage and, like its counterpart, a slim chance at losing against an opponent who just pushes buttons.

Over the course of the game you'll find yourself learning your character, finding effective set-ups for their Ultras, and learning how to play them better. Some characters are harder to play than others, so the game includes set-ups, bios, and strategies to help new players, as well as suggested match-ups.

name: Gene Hunt's 70's and 80's Trivia Board Game
description:
A trivia game where you move around the board trying to correctly answer all 6 topics before moving back to the centre square.

All questions are related to the 1970s and 1980s (with a strong lean towards the UK).

name: Waddingtons Thomas The Tank Engine And Friends Giant Sized Card Game
description:
Try to get rid of all your cards by placing engines down of the same type that are already in play.

Thomas logo cards are jokers and can allow you to change the engine without needing an engine specific card.

name: Fragile Agile
description:
Two to four player deck builder about developing and testing software.

With help from your pool of talented developers you seek to develop stories, forging them into the epic you aspire to construct. However, even the best developers make mistakes, and therefor bugs do occur.

Building up your software development factory helps you keep your processes under control. Or you can just hope to get away with your low quality product and heap all the misery on to your unsuspecting customer.

Every player starts with a draw deck containing money, developer and epic cards, from which you draw a hand. During your turn, you can use cards to recruit new developers, special programming or testing tools, fix bugs, outsource or build towards completing your epics.

When you complete an epic, you can hand it over to another player. The epic is tested for bugs. Bugs discovered during the test will cause damage to your epic or the other player's deck.

Your final score is determined by the value of the epics you have successfully handed over, the bugs in your deck and being the first player to finish three epics.

name: Zippa Lipps
description:
This is a party game that combines Charades and Chinese whispers, with every player involved in every turn.

It contains a playing board, rule sheet, approximately 4,000 mimes, 6 playing pieces, 5 dice and an egg-timer.

On a player's turn, they role four of the dice to select a mime from the lists provided by putting the four numbers on the dice together.  Each number on the list has a choice of three categories - nouns, verbs and media.

Once a mime is selected, they then select any other player to take out of the room and mime it to them (within a set time limit) using the normal rules of Charades.  No speaking is allowed, so players have to hope their mime is good enough for the other person to get it.

After doing the mime, the first player comes in and selects the next player to go out.  The person who received the mime the first time now has to mime it to the new player...and so on until all players have been outside.  The last player then comes back in and announces what they think is the answer.  Points are then scored and players move around the board until one reaches the finish line.

name: Boccia: Auf dem Tisch
description: Each player has 4 disks. Players shoot their coloured disks, one at a time, at a black disc using a special device to do so. The player who is closest to the black disk scores one or multiple points. Points are scored in a 'jeu de boule' fashion.

name: Pizza Mania
description: Chef calls out toppings for children to put on (and take off) their pizzas. Reinforces listening, counting, and early addition and subtraction. After 1 minute, Chef calls out what toppings the pizzas should have. All players with the correct toppings win.

name: The Convicted
description:
The Convicted is a cooperative board game for 1-4 players. Fight for survival in a hostile land, expand your town and stand ground against continuous surge of enemies!

In The Convicted players become convicts who were given a second chance to expiate their crimes. In order to prove their devotion, they need to colonize new lands in the name of the king. They start building their headquarters – town – with just a handful of footman, and a few structures. Through the development of fortifications, buildings, researching new technologies, gathering resources and training recruits they can transform their colony into an impenetrable fortress. Alas, the new world is full of indigenous inhabitants who by any means possible try to get rid of unwanted colonizers. Countless hordes of barbarians, forest people, ferocious monsters and wolf men with their beasts and war machines will spare no effort to storm the town and its defenders. The whole game-play consists of a campaign of 20 turns, ~45 minutes each (15 hours total). The use of random opponent selections and attack directions makes each game a unique experience.

Maybe once you've beaten back the roundheels in the one-off brawls, you can go on to fight in the bigger tournaments...
